citation.article-title: Pedobacter sandarakinus sp. nov., isolated from soil
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Pedobacter sandarakinus sp. nov.
Pedobacter sandarakinus [san.da.ra.ki′nus. N.L. masc. adj. sandarakinus (from Gr. adj. sandarakinos) orange-coloured].
Cells are Gram-negative, non-spore-forming, non-flagellated rods (0.3–0.5×0.7–4.0 μm); occasionally cells >50 μm in length may occur.
Colonies on TSA are circular, convex, smooth, glistening, orange-coloured and 1.5–2.5 mm in diameter after incubation for 5 days at 30 °C.
Optimal growth occurs at 30 °C; growth occurs at 4 and 33 °C, but not at 34 °C.
Optimal pH for growth is 7.0–7.5; growth occurs at pH 5.5, but not at pH 5.0.
Optimal growth occurs in the presence of 0–0.5 % (w/v) NaCl; growth does not occur in the presence of >3 % (w/v) NaCl.
Growth does not occur under anaerobic conditions on TSA or on TSA supplemented with nitrate.
Tweens 20, 40, 60 and 80 are hydrolysed, but casein, gelatin, starch, hypoxanthine, xanthine and l-tyrosine are not.
In assays with the API ZYM system, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase is present.
Susceptible to novobiocin, lincomycin and oleandomycin, but not to polymyxin B, streptomycin, cephalothin, gentamicin, carbenicillin or neomycin.
The major fatty acids (>10 % of total fatty acids) are iso-C15 : 0, C16 : 1ω7c and/or iso-C15 : 0 2-OH and iso-C17 : 0 3-OH.
The DNA G+C content is 39.7 mol% (HPLC).

The type strain, DS-27T (=KCTC 12559T=CIP 108922T), was isolated from soil.
